title: Convert all currency displays from USD ($) to Indian Rupees (₹)

requirements.text: Convert all currency displays throughout the application from US Dollars ($) to Indian Rupees (₹). Update the currency formatting utility in frontend/src/lib/utils.ts so that the formatCurrency (or equivalent) function uses the 'en-IN' locale and 'INR' currency code, rendering the ₹ symbol instead of $. Ensure this change propagates to all pages and components that display monetary values: Dashboard metrics (total revenue, monthly revenue summary), Invoices (line item prices, totals, invoice summary), Expenses (amounts, category summaries), Inventory/Products (unit prices), Reports (revenue charts, expense vs revenue breakdown, top products).
acceptanceCriteria: The formatCurrency utility uses locale 'en-IN' and currency 'INR', displaying ₹ symbol.
Dashboard total revenue and monthly revenue figures display with ₹ symbol.
Invoice line item prices, subtotals, and totals display with ₹ symbol.
Expense amounts and category-grouped totals display with ₹ symbol.
Product/Inventory unit prices display with ₹ symbol.
Reports page revenue bars, expense vs revenue comparison, and top products revenue display with ₹ symbol.
No $ symbol appears anywhere in the application UI.

constraints: Do not alter any files listed under frontend.immutablePaths.
Do not change the backend data model or storage; this is a display-only currency change.
All other existing functionality must remain unaffected.
nonGoals: Adding multi-currency support or currency conversion logic.
Changing the backend numeric storage format.
Modifying any authentication or identity-related code.
